page.title: 10CUSTOMS:1, PADIHAM LANCS
page.content: {Whit Walk} The walk, each Whit Sunday, is a procession of witness to the Christian faith & has taken place for well over a century. In 1985 police closed the main road for 1\ hours as about 2000 people walked. Nearly 5000 lined the streets to watch the spectacle which included 6 huge banners, 9 bands, Rose queen with attendants & colourful, large religious texts. The larger banners needed 2 men wearing special harnesses to carry them and 4 people to hold guy ropes. Ten chuches of different denominations were represented. A short act of worship at St Leonard's church was led by ministers of these denominations.
